v1.headline: Helping Mid-Career Pros Build Second Income Through Day Trading | Author of How to Day Trade for a Living | Peak Performance Advocate
v1.about:
Most people who try trading lose money.

Why?

Because they treat it like gambling, jump between strategies, and never build the discipline to stick to a process.

I know, because that was me when I started.

I had just been laid off from my engineering job. I put my severance into trading, and within months most of it was gone. But instead of walking away, I decided to figure out how to do it right.

I studied the markets like an engineer. I tested strategies. I wrote down every mistake. I learned to manage risk. Slowly, trading became less like a slot machine - and more like a skill I could rely on.

That process became my first book, How to Day Trade for a Living, which went on to become an Amazon bestseller in 17 languages. It also became Bear Bull Traders, a community where traders at every level can learn together, practice, and hold each other accountable.
